title: Sarla Bhat Murder Case: Kashmiri Pandit Nurse Killed In 1990 Terror Attack

title: 'Not doing well': Trump calls tariffs on India over Russian oil 'big blow' to Moscow
content: Donald Trump claimed that US tariffs on India for purchasing Russian oil significantly impacted Moscow's economy, highlighting a 50% duty on Delhi. He stated that Russia's economy is struggling due to global pressures and the conflict. Trump mentioned a potential meeting with Russia to discuss resolution, noting European leaders' desire to end the conflict and focus on their own economies.

title: Kashmiri Pandits' exodus: Raids at 8 locations over 1990 murder of Sarla Bhat
content: The State Investigation Agency (SIA) conducted raids in central Kashmir, targeting former members of the banned JKLF, as part of their investigation into the 1990 murder of Sarla Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit woman. Bhat disappeared from her hostel in April 1990, and her body was later discovered in Srinagar.

title: 'Freeze their assets': Canada‚Äôs opposition seeks terror tag for Bishnoi gang
content: Canada's Conservative Party is pressing Prime Minister Mark Carney to classify the Lawrence Bishnoi gang as a terrorist entity following a surge in violent incidents and extortion attempts impacting South Asian communities in British Columbia, Alberta, and Ontario. Allegedly linked to organized crime, the gang has claimed responsibility for shootings, including attacks on Kapil Sharma's caf√©.

title: Who is Georgina Rodriguez? Cristiano Ronaldo‚Äôs fianc√©e
content: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez have announced their engagement after eight years together, Rodriguez shared the news on Instagram, showcasing a diamond ring. Their relationship began in 2016, and they share a blended family, including five children. Rodriguez, a model and influencer, stars in her own Netflix series, 'I Am Georgina'. The engagement marks a significant milestone in their journey.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to staff: Not enough to be a software factory; calls for innovation
content: Microsoft is undergoing a significant shift, transitioning from a software manufacturer to an "intelligence engine," according to CEO Satya Nadella. This transformation aims to democratize AI, empowering global users to create their own intelligent tools. Microsoft will focus on building AI systems that enable individuals and organizations to develop customized solutions, redesigning its technology stack to support this new vision.

title: Priyanka condemns Israel for 'cold-blooded murder' of Al Jazeera reporters
content: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra condemned the Israeli strike that killed five Al Jazeera journalists, labeling it a "cold-blooded murder." She lauded the reporters' dedication to truth, accusing Israel of silencing them before a planned Gaza offensive. Israel has long accused Al Jazeera of being a Hamas mouthpiece, a claim the network denies.

title: 'Osama in a suit': Ex-US official slams Asim Munir; calls Trump's India stance 'wrong'
content: Michael Rubin, a former Pentagon official, has strongly criticized Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, labeling him "Osama bin Laden in a suit" after controversial remarks made on American soil. Munir allegedly threatened to destroy Indian dams and warned of global consequences if Pakistan were to fail, raising concerns about the security of its nuclear arsenal.

title: Body parts found in 19 locations: Woman strangled, limbs cut, dumped by dentist, aides
content: A gruesome murder in Tumakuru district was solved after police discovered a dismembered body scattered across multiple locations. The victim, Lakshmidevamma, was allegedly killed by her son-in-law, Dr. Ramachandraiah, who suspected her of interfering in his marriage and pressuring his daughter.

title: What saying 'no' to Anand Mahindra taught Mahindra Group CEO and MD Anish Shah
content: Anish Shah, Mahindra Group's CEO, revealed that disagreeing with Anand Mahindra early in his career taught him the importance of constructive dissent. This experience highlighted the company's open culture, where diverse views are valued and decisions are based on merit, not hierarchy. Shah emphasizes that effective leadership involves empowering individuals at all levels to contribute their insights.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are rates headed today? Here‚Äôs the outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices remain range-bound, influenced by US economic data, US-China trade relations, and US-Russia talks. Spot gold closed up 1.1% at $3397, but later declined to $3,345 amid a stronger dollar and uncertainty over trade. Investors should watch for support levels at $3,310 and $3,292, with resistance at $3,375 and $3,410.

title: India added to list of countries whose citizens can be deported from UK before appeal
content: In a significant move, the UK has added India to a list of countries whose nationals, convicted of crimes, will face immediate deportation without the option to appeal from within the UK. Under the new "deport now, appeal later" initiative, these individuals will have to participate in appeal hearings remotely from India.

title: 'Yes, I do': Georgina Rodr√≠guez confirms engagement to Cristiano Ronaldo
content: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodr√≠guez are engaged, marking a significant step in their relationship. Georgina announced the news on Instagram, showcasing a dazzling ring. Their romance began in 2016 at a Gucci store in Madrid. They have since built a family, including daughters Alana Martina and Bella Esmeralda, with Georgina also raising Ronaldo's other children.

title: ‚ÄòLosing its relevance‚Äô: Altman on AGI term; Microsoft CEO questions milestone claims
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman downplays the term AGI, stating its relevance is fading due to varying definitions and evolving work landscapes. This contrasts with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's skepticism, who dismisses AGI milestones as mere "nonsensical benchmark hacking.

title: ‚ÄòRemember Oct 7‚Äô: Trump backs Israel plan after 'a good call' with Netanyahu
content: US President Trump stated that Hamas is unlikely to release hostages without altered circumstances, stopping short of fully endorsing Israel's Gaza City plan. He stressed the difficulty of securing the hostages, advocating increased military pressure. Netanyahu's office confirmed discussions about taking control of Hamas strongholds for hostage release and Hamas's defeat.

title: R Ashwin falls victim to Virat Kohli number scam ‚Äî Here‚Äôs what happened
content: Phone number mix-ups create problems for cricketers. A man in Chhattisgarh got Rajat Patidar's old number. He then received calls from Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers. R Ashwin also shared his experience. Someone impersonated Devon Conway and asked for Kohli's number. Ashwin tested the person and found out it was a fake account. These incidents highlight impersonation risks.

title: NEET PG 2025 result soon: Tentative release date; step-by-step guide to download scorecards
content: The NEET PG 2025 results are expected by September 3, 2025, as announced by the National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS). Candidates can check their scorecards on the official NBEMS website using their registration details. The exam held on August 3 is a crucial step for admission to postgraduate medical courses. Stay updated for counselling and admission details.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 below 24,600; BSE Sensex down around 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was below 24,600, BSE Sensex was near 80,500.

title: Watch: Plane carrying 4 crashes at Montana airport
content: A Socata TBM 700 turboprop, carrying four individuals, crashed into a parked aircraft while landing at Kalispell City Airport in Montana. The collision ignited a fire that spread to a grassy area, affecting several aircraft. The pilot and passengers evacuated the plane, with two passengers sustaining minor injuries treated at the airport.

title: Youngest ever! 10-year-old shocks Grandmaster, sets historic chess record
content: Bodhana Sivanandan, a 10-year-old chess prodigy from Harrow, has made history as the youngest female player to defeat a grandmaster, surpassing Carissa Yip's previous record. She achieved this remarkable feat at the 2025 British Chess Championships in Liverpool, defeating Grandmaster Peter Wells.

title: 117-million-year-old mud waves study: Atlantic‚Äôs birth revealed; key findings
content: A groundbreaking study unveils 117-million-year-old mud waves beneath the Atlantic, reshaping our understanding of its formation. These massive structures, sculpted by ancient underwater avalanches, indicate the Atlantic Ocean connected earlier than previously thought. This discovery provides insights into Cretaceous climate shifts and tectonic movements, offering crucial data for modern geology and climate science.

title: US extends China tariff truce by 90 days; Trump-Xi summit on cards?
content: President Trump has extended the trade truce with China for 90 days, delaying tariff escalations and export controls. This extension aims to provide more time for Washington and Beijing to resolve trade disputes and potentially arrange a summit between Trump and Xi Jinping later this year. While negotiations continue, analysts remain cautious about the prospects for a final deal.

title: Domestic help attacks nursing student with machete for commenting on shoddy work
content: In Bengaluru, a nursing student's late-night visit turned violent when a dispute with the family's domestic help escalated. The maid, G Lalita, attacked Sushmita with a machete while she slept, following an argument about household chores. Sushmita was severely injured and later sought help, leading to Lalita's arrest in Kolar for attempted murder.

title: Mumbai tragedy: 11-year-old dies after fall from sixth-tier Dahi Handi pyramid
content: In Dahisar (E), tragedy struck as an 11-year-old boy, Mahesh Jadhav, died after falling from the sixth tier of a Dahi Handi pyramid during practice. The incident occurred before Janmashtami, leading to an FIR against the mandal president for negligence, as children under 14 are prohibited from participating. Jadhav's family, migrant labourers from Karnataka, mourns the loss.

title: Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir threatens to target RIL's Jamnagar refinery
content: Pakistan's army chief, Asim Munir, threatened to target Reliance Industries' Jamnagar refinery in Gujarat during a future conflict with India, signaling a shift towards hitting economic assets. Munir referenced a social media post featuring Mukesh Ambani and a Quranic verse, implying an aerial attack on the refinery, which symbolizes India's economic power and refining capacity.

title: 'Low profile by choice': John Abraham on private marriage; avoids parties, loud music
content: John Abraham prioritizes privacy in his marriage to Priya Runchal. He keeps his personal life separate from his film career. John avoids parties and maintains a disciplined routine. He values Priya's role in bringing stability to their marriage. The couple celebrated their 10th anniversary in June 2024. Priya prefers to stay out of the limelight and focuses on meaningful work.

title: IND vs ENG: When history knocked, India left the door ajar
content: India‚Äôs 2-2 draw in the inaugural Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy was a series of high drama, spectacular comebacks, and glaring missed opportunities. Shubman Gill‚Äôs young side matched England punch for punch but faltered in the fundamentals ‚Äî from dropped catches to inconsistent bowling ‚Äî leaving what could have been a historic series win just out of reach.

title: Chopra on Rohit & Kohli: ‚ÄòTests toughest, ODIs easiest ‚Äì 'Said goodbye to wrong format‚Äô'
content: Aakash Chopra believes Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli erred by retiring from Test cricket, suggesting their ODI careers might also be nearing an end. He argues that ODIs offer less pressure and fewer opportunities to stay motivated compared to the challenges and consistent engagement provided by Test cricket.

title: Texas shooting: 3 dead at Austin's Target store; gunman arrested
content: In a tragic incident in Austin, a gunman opened fire in a Target parking lot, resulting in three fatalities. The suspect, described as a man in his 30s with a mental health history, stole two vehicles before being apprehended by police. The attack unfolded during busy shopping hours, causing widespread panic.

title: How much Ronaldo‚Äôs engagement ring for Georgina really costs?
content: Cristiano Ronaldo, 40, and Georgina Rodriguez, 31, are engaged! Rodriguez revealed the stunning diamond ring, potentially worth up to $5 million, on Instagram. The couple, together since 2017 and parents to five children, met at a Gucci store. Jewelry experts estimate the flawless, brilliant-cut oval diamond could be as large as 30 carats, making it a truly remarkable piece.

title: Man consults ChatGPT for diet advice; later diagnosed with bromide intoxication
content: A man seeking a healthier diet consulted ChatGPT for a salt alternative and was advised to use sodium bromide. After three months, he landed in the emergency department with severe psychiatric symptoms, later diagnosed as bromism. This case highlights the potential dangers of AI-generated health advice and the importance of critical evaluation.

title: 43 people still missing in Uttarkashi flash floods, says govt in first official note
content: Following the devastating flash flood in Dharali on August 5th, officials report 43 people still missing amidst warnings of more heavy rainfall in Uttarkashi until August 15th, potentially hindering search and relief efforts. A joint task force is navigating unstable terrain to find those trapped, while road repairs are underway despite weather challenges.

title: Zelenskyy dials PM Modi, seeks support ahead of Trump-Putin meet
content: Amidst escalating efforts to resolve the Russia-Ukraine war, PM Modi and President Zelenskyy engaged in discussions, with Zelenskyy advocating for limitations on Russian energy exports. Modi reiterated India's commitment to a peaceful resolution and offered support for strengthening bilateral ties. Zelenskyy also expressed his desire to meet Modi in September at the UNGA sidelines in New York.

title: Delhi HC seeks Yasin Malik's reply in 4 wks on NIA's plea for death penalty
content: The Delhi High Court has directed Kashmiri separatist Yasin Malik to respond within four weeks to the NIA's request for a death penalty in a terror funding case. Malik, the JKLF chief, was expected to appear virtually from Tihar Jail but was not produced.

title: Heart-warming moment: Agassi and Graf‚Äôs daughter beams with pride
content: Andre Agassi addressed Shore Capital Partner‚Äôs Leadership Academy in New York City on July 14, 2025, emphasizing leadership, mindset, and purpose. Following the fireside chat with Jish Bia, Agassi's daughter, Jaz, expressed her admiration on Instagram. Agassi has previously discussed parenting and his efforts to break negative cycles, highlighting his and Steffi Graf's influence on their children.

title: 'When we get that click': Ronaldo‚Äôs old words on marrying Georgina resurface after engagement - Watch
content: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez are now engaged. Georgina shared the news on Instagram. She posted a picture of a diamond ring. The couple met in 2016 in Madrid. They have built a close family together. They are raising two daughters. Ronaldo also has three other children. The couple had spoken about marriage in the past.

title: Georgina Rodr√≠guez engaged to Ronaldo after 9 yrs ‚Äî inside their love story, family, and glamorous life
content: Georgina Rodr√≠guez and Cristiano Ronaldo have officially announced their engagement, captivating fans worldwide. From her humble beginnings in Spain to her rise as a model, influencer, and businesswoman, Georgina's journey alongside Ronaldo has been a public fairy tale. The couple's enduring partnership, marked by both joy and sorrow, culminates in a highly anticipated wedding.

title: Amit Shah praises security forces for conduct of smooth Amarnath Yatra
content: Home Minister Amit Shah lauded security forces for the secure and seamless Amarnath Yatra, which saw over 4.1 lakh pilgrims this year. This pilgrimage followed the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. Shah congratulated the security forces, the Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board, the J&K administration, and voluntary organizations for their commendable contributions to the successful pilgrimage.

title: 'War 2': Hrithik Roshan & Jr NTR starrer sells 1.26 lakh ticketstouch Rs 8.50 crore
content: With just days until its release, 'War 2', part of the YRF Spy Universe starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, is generating significant pre-sales. The film has already sold over 1.26 lakh tickets, with advance sales reaching approximately Rs 4.1 crore, expected to rise further.

title: Magic Johnson & Wife Cookie share heartfelt moment honouring Lakers legend‚Äôs mother
content: Magic Johnson celebrated his mother, Christine Johnson's, 90th birthday with a heartfelt party alongside his wife, Cookie, and their children. The event, filled with love and appreciation, honored Christine's life dedicated to the Lord. Gospel artist Tamela Mann surprised Christine with a performance, making the celebration even more special at Breslin Arena.

title: Tom Brady on Josh Allen & Lamar Jackson: ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt love predictions & hypothesizing‚Äô about first Super Bowl win
content: Tom Brady refrained from picking the next Super Bowl-winning quarterback, despite being prompted about contenders like Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson. He emphasized that past accolades and MVP awards don't guarantee future success. Brady highlighted the importance of relentless preparation, leadership, and resilience, noting that championship journeys must be earned each season.

title: How can Pak General give N-threat from land of a friendly nation, ask MPs in Parliament
content: Indian Parliamentarians have expressed concerns to the government regarding Pakistan army chief Asim Munir's 'nuclear sabre-rattling' made while in the US. MPs questioned how such a statement could originate from a 'strategic ally's' soil, linking it to Munir's prior statement before the Pahalgam attack, also connected to the US.

title: Skylar Thompson‚Äôs mental & physical preseason drive sparks Steelers‚Äô quarterback shakeup
content: Skylar Thompson is making waves in the Pittsburgh Steelers' preseason, showcasing poise and sharp decision-making. His ability to perform under pressure, coupled with impressive stats, is forcing a reevaluation of the team's quarterback depth chart. Coach Tomlin praises Thompson's smart decisions and confidence, highlighting his mental toughness as a key asset in securing a roster spot amidst intense competition.

title: NHL Trade Rumors: Montreal Canadiens eye Mason McTavish, but Anaheim Ducks‚Äô asking price for star center is steep
content: Trade rumors are swirling around Anaheim Ducks center Mason McTavish, with the Montreal Canadiens showing interest. Anaheim's GM Pat Verbeek is reportedly seeking a top-four, right-handed defenseman like Montreal's prospect David Reinbacher in exchange. This potential trade presents a dilemma for Montreal, weighing McTavish's immediate impact against Reinbacher's long-term value.

title: Should merit-cum-income policy guide filling quota posts?
content: The Supreme Court of India is examining a petition to prioritize the most socially and economically backward within SC, ST, and OBC communities for government jobs and educational admissions. Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi are seeking the Union government's response on this sensitive matter.

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Tyler Shough's debut a mixed bag for Saints

title: AP preseason poll reaction: One big number for every team
content: the first AP poll of the 2025 college football season has been released . Texas begins the season at No. 1 followed by Penn State, Ohio State, Clemson and Georgia . the defending champion and third-ranked Ohio State is a rematch of last season's college football playoff semifinal .

title: NFL Future Power Rankings: We stacked all 32 teams' long-term expectations
content: in our annual Future Power Rankings, we ranked which teams are primed to be among the league's best over the next three seasons (2025 through 2027) each of the four categories was weighted to create the overall score: quarterback (20%), roster (30%), front office (25%) and coaching (25%). the results are based on how well each team is positioned for the future.
